name: Arrows (20)
description: A bundle of 20 arrows, useful for ranged attacks with a bow.

name: Blowgun needles (50)
description: A bag of 50 needles designed for use with a blowgun.

name: Crossbow bolts (20)
description: A bundle of 20 bolts for a crossbow.

name: Sling bullets (20)
description: A bag of 20 small lead projectiles for use with a sling.

name: Crystal
description: A clear, polished crystal that can be used as an arcane focus.

name: Orb
description: A glass or crystal orb that can be used as an arcane focus.

name: Rod
description: A wooden rod that can be used as an arcane focus.

name: Staff
description: A wooden staff that can be used as an arcane focus.

name: Wand
description: A wand-like length of wood that can be used as an arcane focus.

name: Sprig of mistletoe
description: A small sprig of the mystical mistletoe plant, used as a druidic focus.

name: Totem
description: A small carved totem representing a spiritual or natural symbol, used as a druidic focus.

name: Wooden staff
description: A wooden staff that can be used as a druidic focus.

name: Yew wand
description: A wand carved from the sacred yew tree, used as a druidic focus.

name: Amulet
description: An amulet or pendant bearing a holy symbol, used as a cleric or paladin's spellcasting focus.

name: Emblem
description: A holy symbol carefully engraved or inlaid onto a shield or other object, used as a spellcasting focus.

name: Reliquary
description: A small container holding a fragment of a sacred relic, used as a spellcasting focus.

name: Abacus
description: A device used for performing mathematical calculations.

name: Acid (vial)
description: A vial of corrosive acid that can be used as an improvised weapon.

name: Alchemist's fire (flask)
description: A flask of sticky, adhesive fluid that ignites when exposed to air, dealing fire damage.

name: Antitoxin (vial)
description: A vial of liquid that provides advantage on saving throws against poison.

name: Backpack
description: A sturdy backpack for carrying gear and supplies.

name: Ball bearings (bag of 1,000)
description: A bag containing 1,000 tiny metal balls that can be used to create a slippery surface.

name: Barrel
description: A wooden barrel that can hold 40 gallons of liquid or 4 cubic feet of solid material.

name: Basket
description: A woven basket that can hold 2 cubic feet or 40 pounds of gear.

name: Bedroll
description: A roll of sturdy fabric that can be used as a sleeping mat or blanket.

name: Bell
description: A small, handheld bell that can be rung to attract attention.

name: Blanket
description: A thick woolen blanket for warmth and comfort.

name: Block and tackle
description: A set of pulleys and a rope that can be used to hoist heavy objects.

name: Book
description: A bound volume containing text, diagrams, or other information.

name: Bottle, glass
description: A glass bottle that can hold 1.5 pints of liquid.

name: Bucket
description: A simple wooden or metal bucket for carrying liquids or other materials.

name: Caltrops (bag of 20)
description: A bag containing 20 sharp, four-pronged metal caltrops that can damage the feet of creatures stepping on them.

name: Candle
description: A tallow or wax candle that provides light for 1 hour.

name: Case, crossbow bolt
description: A wooden case that can hold up to 20 crossbow bolts.

name: Case, map or scroll
description: A cylindrical leather case that can hold up to 10 rolled-up sheets of paper or 5 rolled-up sheets of parchment.

name: Chain (10 feet)
description: A 10-foot length of sturdy metal chain with 10 hit points.

name: Chalk (1 piece)
description: A single piece of chalk, useful for writing or marking surfaces.

name: Chest
description: A wooden chest that can hold 12 cubic feet or 300 pounds of gear.

name: Climber's kit
description: A kit containing special pitons, boot tips, gloves, and a harness to aid in climbing.

name: Clothes, common
description: A set of plain, functional clothing suitable for everyday wear.

name: Clothes, costume
description: A set of elaborate, fancy clothing for use in costumes or performances.

name: Clothes, fine
description: A set of high-quality, expensive clothing made from fine materials.

name: Clothes, traveler's
description: A set of sturdy, practical clothing suitable for travel and adventuring.

name: Component pouch
description: A small, watertight leather pouch containing various material components for spellcasting.

name: Crowbar
description: A sturdy metal bar used to pry open doors, chests, and other objects.

name: Fishing tackle
description: A kit containing a wooden rod, line, hooks, lures, and other equipment for fishing.

name: Healer's kit
description: A leather pouch containing bandages, salves, and splints that can be used to stabilize creatures at 0 hit points.

name: Holy water (flask)
description: A flask of blessed holy water that can be used as an improvised weapon against fiends and undead.

name: Hourglass
description: A small hourglass that can be used to measure the passage of time.

name: Hunting trap
description: A spring-loaded trap that snaps shut on a creature's foot, dealing damage and restricting its movement.

name: Ink (1 ounce bottle)
description: A small bottle containing 1 ounce of ink, useful for writing or drawing.

name: Ink pen
description: A simple pen made for writing with ink.

name: Jug or pitcher
description: A ceramic or clay jug or pitcher that can hold 1 gallon of liquid.

name: Ladder (10 foot)
description: A 10-foot-long wooden ladder.

name: Lamp
description: An oil lamp that provides bright light in a 15-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet.

name: Lantern, bullseye
description: A lantern with a focusing lens that casts bright light in a 60-foot cone and dim light for an additional 60 feet.

name: Lantern, hooded
description: A lantern with a hood that can be lowered to reduce the light to dim in a 5-foot radius.

name: Lock
description: A sturdy lock with a key, requiring a successful Dexterity check to pick.

name: Magnifying glass
description: A lens that allows for closer inspection of small objects and can be used to start fires in bright light.

name: Manacles
description: A set of metal restraints that can bind a Small or Medium creature, requiring a successful Strength or Dexterity check to escape.

name: Mess kit
description: A tin box containing a cup, utensils, and a small cooking pan.

name: Mirror, steel
description: A small, reflective steel mirror.

name: Oil (flask)
description: A flask of oil that can be used as an improvised weapon or to fuel a fire.

name: Paper (one sheet)
description: A single sheet of paper, suitable for writing or drawing.

name: Parchment (one sheet)
description: A single sheet of parchment, suitable for writing or drawing.

name: Perfume (vial)
description: A small vial of fragrant perfume.

name: Pick, miner's
description: A sturdy pick used for mining and excavation.

name: Piton
description: A metal spike used for climbing, driving into walls or rock faces.

name: Poison, basic (vial)
description: A vial of basic poison that can be applied to a weapon or ammunition.

name: Pole (10-foot)
description: A 10-foot wooden pole, useful for probing, pushing, or simple construction.

name: Pot, iron
description: A sturdy iron pot that can hold 1 gallon of liquid.

name: Potion of healing
description: A magical potion that restores 2d4 + 2 hit points when consumed.

name: Pouch
description: A small cloth or leather pouch that can hold up to 20 sling bullets or 50 blowgun needles.

name: Quiver
description: A container that can hold up to 20 arrows.

name: Ram, portable
description: A sturdy, portable battering ram that can be used to break down doors, granting a +4 bonus to Strength checks.

name: Rations (1 day)
description: A day's worth of dried foods suitable for travel, such as jerky, dried fruit, hardtack, and nuts.

name: Robes
description: A set of simple, flowing robes.

name: Rope, hempen (50 feet)
description: A 50-foot length of sturdy hemp rope with 2 hit points.

name: Rope, silk (50 feet)
description: A 50-foot length of fine, lightweight silk rope with 2 hit points.

name: Sack
description: A simple cloth sack that can hold up to 1 cubic foot or 30 pounds of gear.

name: Scale, merchant's
description: A set of scales with pans and weights, used to accurately measure the weight of small objects.

name: Sealing wax
description: A stick of wax used to seal documents or containers.

name: Shovel
description: A sturdy, metal shovel used for digging and excavation.

name: Signal whistle
description: A small whistle that can be used to attract attention or give signals.

name: Signet ring
description: A ring bearing a unique symbol or design, used to make an impression in wax or ink.

name: Soap
description: A small bar of soap, useful for cleaning.

name: Spellbook
description: A leather-bound tome with 100 blank vellum pages, essential for wizards to record their spells.

name: Spikes, iron (10)
description: A bundle of 10 sturdy iron spikes, useful for securing objects or creating crude obstacles.

name: Spyglass
description: A small telescope that magnifies objects to twice their normal size.

name: Tent, two-person
description: A simple, portable canvas shelter that can accommodate two people.

name: Tinderbox
description: A small container with flint, fire steel, and tinder to aid in starting fires.

name: Torch
description: A wooden torch that burns for 1 hour, providing bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet.

name: Vial
description: A small glass vial that can hold 4 ounces of liquid.

name: Waterskin
description: A leather waterskin that can hold 4 pints of liquid.

name: Whetstone
description: A stone used to sharpen blades and tools.
